> And yes, the topology example seems strange, no hardware the same, so, what about

I'm all for testing boundaries and adding made-up topologies to exercise the code more. So conceptually this is fine by me as long as...

>     1. Add some descriptions for futher clarify? or

...fake topologies used for testing are clearly marked as such. Is completely fine by me to have a bunch of those clearly labeled "for testing purposes only". Simply a comment is more than enough here.

>     2. Add the related testcase while my feature PR pushed with another comparsion which almost 100% brings out the problem? do not need the triple socket toplogy added more, exists topology also meets problem. or

This is another fine option. Having a (variation of) an existing topology to expose the problem is also fine.
I actually expect (and I'd happy to provide when I get the chance) more testing topologies to be added to the tests.

For this specific fix, both options are fine, whatever work best to make this PR progress.
